segments.en: Linked Discourses 3
1. Shackles
1. Young
So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho rājā pasenadi kosalo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “bhavampi no gotamo anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddhoti paṭijānātī”ti?
segments.en: “Does Master Gotama claim to have awakened to the supreme perfect awakening?”

segments.pli: “Yañhi taṃ, mahārāja, sammā vadamāno vadeyya ‘anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho’ti, mameva taṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya.
segments.en: “If anyone should rightly be said to have awakened to the supreme perfect awakening, it’s me.
For, great king, I have awakened to the supreme perfect awakening.”

segments.pli: “Yepi te, bho gotama, samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: “Well, there are those ascetics and brahmins who lead an order and a community, and teach a community. They’re well-known and famous religious founders, regarded as holy by many people. That is,

segments.pli: pūraṇo kassapo, makkhali gosālo, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto, sañcayo belaṭṭhaputto, pakudho kaccāyano, ajito kesakambalo;
segments.en: Pūraṇa Kassapa, Makkhali Gosāla, Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta, Sañjaya Belaṭṭhiputta, Pakudha Kaccāyana, and Ajita Kesakambala.

segments.pli: tepi mayā ‘anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddhoti paṭijānāthā’ti puṭṭhā samānā anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddhoti na paṭijānanti.
segments.en: I also asked them whether they claimed to have awakened to the supreme perfect awakening, but they made no such claim.

segments.pli: Kiṃ pana bhavaṃ gotamo daharo ceva jātiyā navo ca pabbajjāyā”ti?
segments.en: So why do you, given that you’re so young in age and newly gone forth?”

segments.pli: “Cattāro kho me, mahārāja, daharāti na uññātabbā, daharāti na paribhotabbā.
segments.en: “Great king, these four things should not be looked down on or disparaged because they are young.
What four?

segments.pli: Khattiyo kho, mahārāja, daharoti na uññātabbo, daharoti na paribhotabbo.
segments.en: An aristocrat,

segments.pli: Urago kho, mahārāja, daharoti na uññātabbo, daharoti na paribhotabbo.
segments.en: a snake,

segments.pli: Aggi kho, mahārāja, daharoti na uññātabbo, daharoti na paribhotabbo.
segments.en: a fire,

segments.pli: Bhikkhu, kho, mahārāja, daharoti na uññātabbo, daharoti na paribhotabbo.
segments.en: and a mendicant.

segments.pli: Ime kho, mahārāja, cattāro daharāti na uññātabbā, daharāti na paribhotabbā”ti.
segments.en: These four things should not be looked down on or disparaged because they are young.”
That is what the Buddha said.

segments.pli: Idaṃ vatvāna sugato athāparaṃ etadavoca satthā:
segments.en: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
“A man should not despise
an aristocrat of impeccable lineage,
high-born and famous,
just because they’re young.
For it’s possible that that lord of men,
as aristocrat, will gain the throne.
And in his anger he’ll execute a royal punishment,
and have you violently beaten.
Hence you should avoid him
for the sake of your own life.
Whether in village or wilderness,
wherever a serpent is seen,
a man should not look down on it
or despise it for its youth.
With its rainbow of colors,
the snake of fiery breath glides along.
It lashes out and bites the fool,
both men and women alike.
Hence you should avoid it
for the sake of your own life.
A fire devours a huge amount,
a conflagration with a blackened trail.
A man should not look down on it
just because it’s young.
For once it gets fuel
it’ll become a huge conflagration.
It’ll lash out and burn the fool,
both men and women alike.
Hence you should avoid it
for the sake of your own life.
When a forest is burned by fire,
a conflagration with a blackened trail,
the shoots will spring up there again,
with the passing of the days and nights.
But if a mendicant endowed with ethics
burns you with their power,
you’ll have no sons or cattle,
nor will your heirs find wealth.
Childless and heirless you become,
like a palm-tree stump.
That’s why an astute person,
seeing what’s good for themselves,
would always treat these properly:
a snake, a conflagration,
a famous aristocrat,
and a mendicant endowed with ethics.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, rājā pasenadi kosalo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When this was said, King Pasenadi of Kosala said to the Buddha,
“Excellent, sir! Excellent!

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṃ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
segments.en: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, the Buddha has made the teaching clear in many ways.

segments.pli: Esāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṃghañca.
segments.en: I go for refuge to the Buddha, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Upāsakaṃ maṃ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

suttaplex.blurb: King Pasenadi meets the Buddha for the first time. He wonders how the Buddha can claim to be awakened when he is still so young. The Buddha teaches him four things that should not be looked down on for their youth.
